intro: Grayia plummeri, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant has narrow, gray-green leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Grayia plummeri is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to desert climates.
